meanings.definition: To become or make wrinkled or contracted
meanings.sent1: Leaves were shrivelling in the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: The old apple was shrivelling up on the counter.
meanings.sent3: The balloon started shrivelling as soon as it was pricked.
meanings.sent4: His hopes of winning the race were shrivelling away.
meanings.sent5: The once plump grape was now shrivelling into a raisin.

meanings.sent1: The flowers were shrivelling without water.
meanings.sent2: His enthusiasm for the project was shrivelling with each setback.
meanings.sent3: The party was shrivelling down to just a few guests.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was shrivelling like a deflating balloon.
meanings.sent5: The fire was shrivelling, barely flickering in the wind.
